overview:
Chris Regan is a graduate of Bates College and an MBA candidate in the Evening Program at Babson College. He has held product management and VP National Sales roles in the Pro A/V and Broadcast equipment industries. In 2004, he was part of co-founder Robert Crowleyâ€™s team that founded Crowley and Tripp Microphones, a Pro A/V startup that marketed new acoustic sensor technology and was acquired by microphone market leader Shure Inc. in Jan. 2009.

Chris currently leads wireless hardware startup RFvenue, a tech company whose new antenna, receiver, and transmitter technology addresse common signal interference and audio dropout problems associated with wireless microphone systems and audiovisual production communications. The company’s Local Field Sensor technology creates high quality nearfield reception areas for desired signals and reduces reception of unwanted interference sources.
